ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Numeric Visit Number
Notes: -1.5 = Pre-Screening; -1 = Screening; 0 = Baseline; ## = Visit ## (from 1 to 10); Whole numbers = standard monthly visits; #.001 - #.009 = Unscheduled; #.1 = End of Phase 1; #.2 = End of Phase 2; #.3 = End of Phase 3; #.4 = End of Open Choice Phase; #.5 = End of Study; #.6 = Genetic Analysis; 1000=all visits

ElementDescription: Visit name
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2

ElementDescription: Staff code number of person completing this form
Notes: 999= Missing Data

ElementDescription: 1. I have contact information for at least one health care professional (such as doctor or therapist) whom I can call during a suicidal crisis.
Notes: 4 = Strongly Agree ; 3 = Somewhat Agree ; 2 = Unsure ; 1 = Somewhat Disagree ; 0 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: 2.	I recognize the circumstances or people that can make me suicidal.
Notes: 4 = Strongly Agree ; 3 = Somewhat Agree ; 2 = Unsure ; 1 = Somewhat Disagree ; 0 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: 3.	I cannot do anything to control my suicidal thoughts.
Notes: 0 = Strongly Agree ; 1 = Somewhat Agree ; 2 = Unsure ; 3 = Somewhat Disagree ; 4 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: 4.	I know which friends and/or family members to contact to help take my mind off my suicidal feelings.
Notes: 4 = Strongly Agree ; 3 = Somewhat Agree ; 2 = Unsure ; 1 = Somewhat Disagree ; 0 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: 5.	I know the nearest hospital or urgent care facility where I can go if I cannot handle my suicidal feelings.
Notes: 4 = Strongly Agree ; 3 = Somewhat Agree ; 2 = Unsure ; 1 = Somewhat Disagree ; 0 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: 6.	When I feel suicidal, there are places I can go (such as a coffee shop, the gym, place of worship, or shopping mall) to help me take my mind off my problems.
Notes: 4 = Strongly Agree ; 3 = Somewhat Agree ; 2 = Unsure ; 1 = Somewhat Disagree ; 0 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: 7.	If I try, it is possible for me to figure out some of the feelings, thoughts, and/or behaviors that led to my becoming suicidal.
Notes: 4 = Strongly Agree ; 3 = Somewhat Agree ; 2 = Unsure ; 1 = Somewhat Disagree ; 0 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: 8.	I have several things I can do to get through a suicidal crisis.
Notes: 4 = Strongly Agree ; 3 = Somewhat Agree ; 2 = Unsure ; 1 = Somewhat Disagree ; 0 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: 9.	I am able to confide in someone, such as a friend, family member, supervisor, or spiritual advisor when I am experiencing a crisis.
Notes: 4 = Strongly Agree ; 3 = Somewhat Agree ; 2 = Unsure ; 1 = Somewhat Disagree ; 0 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: 10.	Seeking help from health care professionals is a good way to keep myself safe when I am feeling suicidal.
Notes: 4 = Strongly Agree ; 3 = Somewhat Agree ; 2 = Unsure ; 1 = Somewhat Disagree ; 0 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: 11.	I know it is important to limit access to weapons or other ways to hurt myself when I am feeling suicidal.
Notes: 4 = Strongly Agree ; 3 = Somewhat Agree ; 2 = Unsure ; 1 = Somewhat Disagree ; 0 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: 12.	Even if I am alone, there are things I can do to take mind off my suicidal feelings and thoughts for at least a while.
Notes: 4 = Strongly Agree ; 3 = Somewhat Agree ; 2 = Unsure ; 1 = Somewhat Disagree ; 0 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: 13.	I do not think there is anything that I can do to help myself when I am feeling suicidal.
Notes: 0 = Strongly Agree ; 1 = Somewhat Agree ; 2 = Unsure ; 3 = Somewhat Disagree ; 4 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: 14.	It is useless to talk to anyone about my suicidal thoughts.
Notes: 0 = Strongly Agree ; 1 = Somewhat Agree ; 2 = Unsure ; 3 = Somewhat Disagree ; 4 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: 15.	I have removed or limited my access to lethal methods (for instance, pills or bullets in a gun) that I could potentially use to hurt myself.
Notes: 4 = Strongly Agree ; 3 = Somewhat Agree ; 2 = Unsure ; 1 = Somewhat Disagree ; 0 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: 16.	When I am suicidal, I know of things to do by myself that help me feel less suicidal.
Notes: 4 = Strongly Agree ; 3 = Somewhat Agree ; 2 = Unsure ; 1 = Somewhat Disagree ; 0 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: 17.	I can distract myself by doing other things  or thinking about other things when I am feeling suicidal.
Notes: 4 = Strongly Agree ; 3 = Somewhat Agree ; 2 = Unsure ; 1 = Somewhat Disagree ; 0 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: 18.	If one way of trying to cope with suicidal feelings does not work, I have other ways to try.
Notes: 4 = Strongly Agree ; 3 = Somewhat Agree ; 2 = Unsure ; 1 = Somewhat Disagree ; 0 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: 19.	I am at the mercy of my suicidal thoughts.
Notes: 0 = Strongly Agree ; 1 = Somewhat Agree ; 2 = Unsure ; 3 = Somewhat Disagree ; 4 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: 20.	I feel that I have no one to turn to when I am feeling suicidal.
Notes: 0 = Strongly Agree ; 1 = Somewhat Agree ; 2 = Unsure ; 3 = Somewhat Disagree ; 4 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: 21.	It can be helpful for me to socialize with other people when I am feeling suicidal.
Notes: 4 = Strongly Agree ; 3 = Somewhat Agree ; 2 = Unsure ; 1 = Somewhat Disagree ; 0 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: 8. I have several things I can do to get through a suicidal crisis.
Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Disagree; 2= Neither agree nor disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree

Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Disagree; 2= Neither agree nor disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree

Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Disagree; 2= Neither agree nor disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree

Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Disagree; 2= Neither agree nor disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: It is possible to prevent suicides.
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Somewhat disagree; 3= Neither agree or disagree; 4= Somewhat agree; 5= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Intervening when someone is suicidal would be helpful.
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Somewhat disagree; 3= Neither agree or disagree; 4= Somewhat agree; 5= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Suicide Related Coping Scale - External Coping Calculation
Notes: Sum of items srcm_1, 4, 5, 9, 11, 14, 20

ElementDescription: Suicide Related Coping Scale - Internal Coping Calculation
Notes: Sum of items srcm_3, 6, 10, 12, 16-18
